Temporary Thread on Personality Types
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Advance 2 Archive (GameBoy Advance): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Temporary Thread on Personality Types
By GoldenBoy on Saturday, January 18, 2003 - 09:51 pm:

It time for an MR version of the Meyers-Briggs Type indicator!

Seriously, there are a lot of different personalities (listed as type in your monster info screen). This is to start to catalog them and get a list going. Eventually we can start to work on descriptions of the effects of each, since the game doesn't provide them.

Now don't take the descriptions as gospel. They are based only on my own observation raising that type of monster. If you disagree, post about your experience.

Please post any others you've encountered. If its unusual, please provide a password for the monster that has it if you can.

TypeDescription
Brave Better in battle
Calm More resistant to stress
Coward Worse in battle
Joker ???
Joyful ???
Lazy Slacks off on Drills
Normal Average Joe
Passion ???
Serious Works harder on Drills
Spoiled ???

By Gizmo the Lemur on Saturday, February 1, 2003 - 01:56 pm:

Maybe the stat change in battle is determined by your monster, or when it gets annoyed it loses defense to dodge attacks or hit better (a la pseudo beserk mode?). I gotta check this personality out whenever I have the chance.

By GoldenBoy on Saturday, February 1, 2003 - 04:58 pm:

By Infernus on Saturday, February 1, 2003 - 11:24 pm:

Some work done on the "Proud" personality with my tigers. It would appear that they gain loyalty slower than other monsters, also, they tend to fail drills more often when you ease up on them(Be mean,be very very mean with proud monsters!...jk,just don't spoil or pamper them.). This was tested with 2 different personality monsters from the same password(one proud, one normal). If anyone else wants to try and see if I'm wrong they can, I used the password 002(zeroes) for a Scarlet(Tiger/Szurin).
BTW,I never realized how hard it was to keep up around here w/o the e-mails :"(

By Infernus on Sunday, February 2, 2003 - 08:45 am:

Just for those who are curious, the proud Scarlet lived longer, had better stats and was more loyal in the end. The reasons for this is most likely because I was able to do more hard drills without it getting stressed out. As for the loyalty, I don't know what happened here but, in the end, I could feed it nothing and it only lost 1 loyalty compared to normal Scarlet's 3.

By Infernus on Sunday, February 2, 2003 - 03:26 pm:

I've started trying this with JammHat (Henger/Suezo). It's from combining and has no password(so sorry). As with the proud Scarlet, the proud JammHat fails it's first drills for about 1-2 months. I do only hard drills. Although the proud monsters seem to fail more often they do quite well in sparring(thats probably because they can't fail...). Again, I'm going to ask that someone else test this out, I'm not sure of myself.
P.S the normal ones succeed in there first drill anywhere between the 2nd and 5th week.

By BattlecatRex on Tuesday, February 11, 2003 - 07:28 pm:

I had a Pixie (Pixie=Pixie) that had "Joker" and the only thing different about her was that she was always getting wierd Traits. One time she got Farsight, I know that that happens to a lot of monsters, but not at 1yr-10m. During her life she got: Farsight, Nearsight, Failure, Listless, Slump, and Worn Out. Every bad trait, I know it might have not been "Joker", but I think it was.

By GoldenBoy on Tuesday, February 11, 2003 - 10:58 pm:

I think unless you can post more about your personal raising method, what items you have and use, what sorts of things you did. I won't buy into that idea. I am much more willing to believe that you hit the gamut of bad traits because you don't have the hang of Pixies than I am to believe it was Joker. I have had Joker personality monsters before and never had that much trouble.

By Moonmonster on Friday, April 18, 2003 - 12:49 pm:

My guesses...
Passion: Not one to fail Drills. A little Stressed. May live shorter.
Joyful: A little lazy, they get Reliance better. Overall...happiness. Likes food.
Joker: Plays during Drills, lower stats*, but higher gain of stats.
Spoiled: Lazy, lazy, lazy. Likes you alot. Lives longer.

*This has not been confirmed.

By Lao Tse on Saturday, June 7, 2003 - 10:22 am:

My experiences with cowards have been that they dodge better than normal. Same species, same raising style, just different personalities. Where my cowardly tigers would have no problem dodging, I have to worry about my normal one (all of which I've found while trying to unlock Whitehound; note that I haven't seen any physical stat difference). Can anybody else confirm this idea?
